snippet: Created to train African forces and build social, political and economic programs, the Pentagon’s Africa Command finds itself facing a new generation of Islamist militants.
abstract: Pentagon’s Africa Command, created to focus on training the armed forces of dozens of African nations and strengthen social, political and economic programs, finds itself confronting a generation of Islamist militants who are testing America's resolve to fight terrorism; officials are trying to address the growing threat by repositioning spy satellites and shifting surveillance aircraft, all at a time when shrinking military budgets are forcing the Obama administration to make difficult choices.
lead_paragraph: Created to train African forces and build social, political and economic programs, the Pentagon’s Africa Command finds itself facing a new generation of Islamist militants.
